Specimens (iv)â€“(vii) are of the long-fingered second pereiopod type , (ix) with short fingers and in (ii) the fingers are subequal to the palm. The specimens (viii) may have been derived from sand-burrowing sponges rather than the eunicid tubes as this species is normally associated with sponges.

Type locality: Ralun , New Britain. Also known from Kenya, Zanzibar, Tanzania, Madagascar, Seychelles, Maldives , Singapore
,
South China
Sea , Philippines , Indonesia ( Borneo Bank )
,
Australia ( Northern Territory, Queensland ), and New Caledonia
.
